intro: Sambucus racemosa plumosa, commonly known as the Canadian arrowwood, is a deciduous shrub native to North America. It belongs to the honeysuckle family (Caprifoliaceae) and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces red,浆果-like berries that are edible for birds and some mammals. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its ornamental value comes from its attractive foliage and seasonal color changes.
